intro: Dictymia dictyopteris, commonly known as the common sea holly, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its salt-tolerant nature, allowing it to thrive in coastal and brackish environments. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are succulent and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
